thread.title: Death of man who plunged from balcony at Barnes-Jewish Hospital medical building was suicide, police say
thread.title_full: Death of man who plunged from balcony at Barnes-Jewish Hospital medical building was suicide, police say

author: From staff reports
title: Death of man who plunged from balcony at Barnes-Jewish Hospital medical building was suicide, police say
text:
Law and order Close 
The atrium of the Center for Advanced Medicine at the Barnes-Jewish Hospital comple in a 2002 image. Photo by Ken Shimizu of the Post-Dispatch Death of man who plunged from balcony at Barnes-Jewish Hospital medical building was suicide, police say From staff reports 42 min ago ( … ) 
The atrium of the Center for Advanced Medicine at the Barnes-Jewish Hospital comple in a 2002 image. Photo by Ken Shimizu of the Post-Dispatch 
ST. LOUIS • A man who plunged to his death Monday morning in a medical building of the Barnes-Jewish Hospital complex killed himself, police said. 
Police said the man, 54, plunged from an upper floor balcony of an atrium at the Center for Advanced Medicine on Forest Park Avenue, just east of Kingshighway. Barnes-Jewish medical personnel responded to the atrium and tried to treat the victim. He was pronounced dead at the scene shortly after 11 a.m. 
Authorities have determined his death to be a suicide. 
A hospital spokeswoman said the West County man was a visitor, not a patient. 
The Center for Advanced Medicine has offices and clinics for many medical services, including the Siteman Cancer Center.
